questions.question: Civilizations that experience Golden Ages are typically characterized by

choices.answer: peace, prosperity, and political stability
constant disorder, civil wars, and a lack of prosperity
a focus on traditional religious practices
policies of isolationism

questions.question: What is one effect that Akbar the Great and the Mughals had on India?

choices.answer: India became unified under one language
Parliamentary republics were established
Hinduism became the dominant religion in Northern India
Muslim culture dominated in parts of India

questions.question: Akbar the Great and Suleiman the Magnificent were both noted for promoting

choices.answer: religious conquest and persecution of minority groups
political stability and religious tolerance in their empires
isolationism and cultural stagnation
modernization and political disunity

questions.question: Which statement is best supported by the information on this map of the Ottoman Empire?

choices.answer: The Ottoman Turks conquered Great Britain
The Ottoman Empire failed to expand into Europe
Ottoman traders gained control of the entire Mediterranean
Ottoman conquests led to expansion into North Africa

questions.question: Which of the following empires was founded after the fall of Constantinople?

choices.answer: Safavid
Roman
Ottoman
Soviet

questions.question: Louis the 14th, Suleiman the Magnificent, and Akbar the Great are similar because

choices.answer: each was an absolute monarch that centralized his power
they were elected rulers of Greek city-states
they were nationalists that led independence movements
they were political thinkers during the Enlightenment

questions.question: Absolute Monarchs used the belief in the Divine Right of Kings to justify

choices.answer: the collapse of the Roman Empire
the need for them to centralize their political power
converting all citizens in their nations to Islam or Sikhism
the rise of Feudal governments in Western Europe

questions.question: Which Chinese invention was responsible for allowing the Ottomans and Mughals to conquer land?

choices.answer: Wooden Block Printing
Gunpowder
Magnetic Compass
Paper

questions.question: Constantinople was viewed as being important by the Ottoman Empire because

choices.answer: it was a midpoint/crossroads between Europe and Asia
it was sacred to all of the Hindus in the Empire
the Islamic Prophet Muhammad was born there
it was the former capital of the Holy Roman Empire

questions.question: Ottoman Expansion led to

choices.answer: the collapse of the Feudal System in Western Europe
an end to cultural diffusion between Europe and the ME
the spread of Islam to the Balkans in Southeastern Europe
Janissaries losing their military power

questions.question: Since Ottoman rulers were tolerant of the diverse backgrounds of the people in the Empire

choices.answer: various religious and historical traditions mixed together
people shunned those that were not Muslims
there was a strict separation of church and state
they prohibited citizens from practicing Christianity

questions.question: Suleiman the Magnificent and Akbar the Great created prosperity by

choices.answer: promoting the doctrine of extraterritoriality
adhering to a strict command economy
encouraging trade in their respective empires
practicing a rigid form of Manorialism

questions.question: The Tokugawa Shoguns stopped trading with foreign nations because they

choices.answer: wanted to prevent Europeans from influencing Japan's culture
forced all of the Samurai to work on farms across Japan
hoped to destroy traditional Japanese culture from within
hoped to eliminate Japanese influence across SE Asia

questions.question: The Ottoman conquest of this Byzantine Capital City signaled the rise of the Empire...

choices.answer: Vienna
Athens
Budapest
Constantinople

questions.question: The Ottoman Empire's geographic location

choices.answer: caused its leaders to repress minority groups' basic rights
led to the spread Zen Buddhism throughout Anatolia
led to prosperity due to its location on vital trade routes
was the sole reason why it collapsed after World War 1

questions.question: Emperor Justinian, Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte and Sultan Suleiman the Magnificent are similar

choices.answer: because each was unable to expand the size of his Empire
because each of them were devout Roman Catholics
because each ruler codified (wrote) a system of law
because each promoted equal rights for both men and women

questions.question: Suleiman the Magnificent and Akbar the Great were similar in their religious practices because

choices.answer: both rulers were followers of Shintoism
both rulers were Muslims since they followed Islam
both rulers spread Catholicism in their respective Empires
both rulers purged non-Muslims from their respective Empires

questions.question: Absolute Rulers are often criticized because they have a tendency to

choices.answer: break away from the RCC
impose feudalism in the nations that they rule
be too committed to the principles of democratic government
implement gov't policies without the consent of the citizens

questions.question: Based on the diagram, which statement about Japan during the Tokugawa period is accurate?

choices.answer: Europeans were able to impose their social system in Japan
The Merchants were greatly respected and had much influence
The Emperor possessed Absolute power
The Shogun was the actual ruler of Japan

questions.question: As the ruler of the Ottoman Empire, Suleiman the Magnificent's title was

choices.answer: Fuhrer
Secretary-General
Czarina
Sultan
